p: The composition of S. africana aerial part oils isolated from plants growing wild in eastern Algeria (Batna) was different from those reported for oils from Morocco [ 4, 5], Tunisia [ 9] and Algeria (Constantine) [ 7, 18], but it should be pointed that a similar composition has been reported for flowerhead oil of S. chamaecyparissus from Tunisia, which also contained 1,8-cineole, β-eudesmol (10.49%), terpinen-4-ol (6.97%), spathulenol (5.80%), camphor (5.27%) and germacrene D (5.03%) as major components [ 20]. Other compounds also occurred as main constituents: δ-cadinene (6.55%) and myrtenol (4.26%) which are present at low amounts in all our samples (tr-0.4%).
